name: Avoid using video poster attributes in combination with javascript
description: Do not allow users to use video markup with poster attribute combined with javascript. This rule is compliant with CISQ OMG ASCSM-CWE-079 recommendation and OWASP 2013 A3 recommendation.
output:
Line and column for each violation 
Associated value => number of violations found
rationale: Ensure you don't use html pattern that can give a way to execute code without user interaction.
remediation: Make sure only relative URIs and correctly MIME-typed data URIs can be used for VIDEO poster attributes

qualityStandards.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
qualityStandards.description: XSS flaws occur whenever an application takes untrusted data and sends it to a web browser without proper validation or escaping. XSS allows attackers to execute scripts in the victims' browser which can hijack user sessions, deface web sites, or redirect the user to malicious sites.

qualityStandards.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
qualityStandards.description: XSS flaws occur whenever an application includes untrusted data in a new web page without proper validation or escaping, or updates an existing web page with user-supplied data using a browser API that can create HTML or JavaScript. XSS allows attackers to execute scripts in the victim's browser which can hijack user sessions, deface web sites, or redirect the user to malicious sites.
